definition: Sichuan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4])
short name for Sichuan 四川[Si4 chuan1] province/one of the Three Kingdoms 三國|三国[San1 guo2] after the Han dynasty, also called 蜀漢|蜀汉[Shu3 Han4], situated around what is now Sichuan province

sentences.english: In the Qing Dynasty, Shu Embroidery entered the market and an industry was formed.
sentences.chinese: 在清代，蜀繡進入市場和產業的形成。

sentences.english: Workshops and governmental bureaus were fully devoted to Shu Embroidery, promoting the development of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 局講習班和政府完全致力於蜀繡，促進行業的發展。

sentences.english: The earliest record of Shu Embroidery was during the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 蜀繡的最早記錄是在西漢。

sentences.english: Shu embroidery enjoys a long history.
sentences.chinese: 蜀繡的生產具有悠久的歷史。

sentences.english: Yue embroidery and Shu embroidery, right?
